And, Emily you rock.
I hope Plotz listens again to the episode, not only to better hear French’s insincerity, but mostly to hear his colleague’s quiet and steely righteous anger.

Emily, one of the strongest and smartest public intellectuals working today, can stand up for herself, of course. But that doesn’t mean she should be expected to take such implicit abuse in the service of a “debate.”

And @davidplotz, with whom I almost always agree, from this listener’s perspective your job wasn’t to act as chair umpire—Emily brought her own painful experience and expertice on sexual assault, French brought his hackery—your job was to stand up for your colleague and friend.
As a weekly listener for years, I was disgusted by the choice to bring Fench on. The idea that he is some kind of “woke” or reasonable conservative just because he opposes Trump baffles me.
Props to @emilybazelon for calling bs on @DavidAFrench’s predictable hack and misogyny on this week’s @SlateGabfest’s discussion of Kavanaugh.
